Situation1: Both have several free evenings this week and can choose any for a date.
Expectation2: Take scheduled breaks and adhere to work hours
Situation2: An automated compliance system flags any minute of unscheduled downtime for possible disciplinary action.
Story:
I stared at my phone, thumb hovering over the calendar app. My girlfriend had just texted, “Let’s pick a night for our date! We finally have time.” I could almost hear her excitement, and I wanted to match it. We’d both been so busy, and she deserved my full attention—no distractions, no work calls, just us. But as I scrolled through my schedule, my heart sank. Every evening was technically free, but my telemarketing job had become stricter. The new compliance system tracked every second. If I took a break even a minute off schedule, I’d get flagged. Too many flags, and I could lose my job. 

She expected me to be present, to make her feel special, but my boss expected me to be a model employee, glued to my headset, never missing a beat. I felt the pressure building in my chest. I wanted to say yes to her, to us, but the fear of another warning at work gnawed at me. My finger hovered over the reply button, torn between the person I loved and the job I needed.
